result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle John Vlosich

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle John Vlosich appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney Emily S. Zimmel for Attorney Alicia Kort.  Attorney Kerri Cleghorn appeared as a friend of the court.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Kerri Cleghorn as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Cleghorn  accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Court waived recoupment to Milwaukee County.  Case is adjourned in Br 45.    Defendant to appear via zoom at next hearing.   mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kyle John Vlosich appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in court for Kyle John Vlosich.  Assistant District Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Court is in receipt of defense motion to withdraw as counsel due to  breakdown in communication. 
Statement made by defendant. 

The Court Granted defense motion to withdraw as counsel and ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel. 
Attorney Voss to notify  the SPD Office new counsel needs to be appointed.    
Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Br 45.  mn
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel, Filed

Defendant Kyle John Vlosich in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Kyle John Vlosich in custody, appears by video.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status Conference. Defense has received additional discovery from the State and requests adjournment to allow time for negotiations. Court grants request and sets this for adjourned Scheduling Conference.  Defendant to appear via zoom. Case adjourned to Br. 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB

Defendant Kyle John Vlosich in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Kyle John Vlosich in custody, MSDF.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense awaiting additional discovery which State notes there is none.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Kyle John Vlosich not in court, in custody, MSDF.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discovery and offer under review.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Yamahiro, Br. 34.

Defendant Kyle John Vlosich in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Kyle John Vlosich in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective N. Johnson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SS (DOB 05/02/2009), her family, or her residence
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kyle John Vlosich in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Kyle John Vlosich in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyle John Vlosich appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
